intro: Barleria linearifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters. The plant features slender, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or red, arranged in dense spikes at the ends of the stems. Barleria linearifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
